gtResult 0.0.1

Create a gt table from a summarised_result object.

Source: R/gtSummarisedResult.R
gtSummarisedResult.Rd

Create a gt table from a summarised_result object.

Usage

gtSummarisedResult(
  result,
  format = NULL,
  splitGroup = TRUE,
  splitStrata = TRUE,
  splitAdditional = FALSE,
  columns = c("variable_name", "variable_level", format = "estimate_name"),
  header = c("cdm_name", "group", "strata"),
  keepNotFormatted = TRUE,
  decimals = c(integer = 0, numeric = 2, percentage = 1, proportion = 3),
  decimalMark = ".",
  bigMark = ",",
  style = list(header = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#c8c8c8"), gt::cell_text(weight =
    "bold")), header_name = list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#e1e1e1")), header_level =
    list(gt::cell_fill(color = "#ffffff"))),
  na = "-"
)

Arguments

result

A summarised_result object.

format

#To inherit from formatEstimateName

splitGroup

Whether to split group_name and group_level in several columns.

splitStrata

Whether to split strata_name and strata_level in several columns.

splitAdditional

Whether to split additional_name and additional_level in several columns.

columns

Columns to keep. You can rename them with this command.

header

Columns to use as spanners in the gt table.

keepNotFormatted

#To inherit formatEstimateName

decimals

#To inherit formatEstimateValue

decimalMark

#To inherit formatEstimateValue

bigMark

#To inherit formatEstimateValue

style

#To inherit gtHeader

na

Substitute for NA values.

Value

A formatted gt table.
